wikipedia_page.main: Sarah Winman (born 24 December 1964 in Ilford, Essex) is a British author and actress.

link_mentions.page: List of fictional rabbits and hares
response: |Sarah Winman

Set up in 2011, the Waterstones 11 was created to promote debut literary fiction from new authors being published in the year ahead. Books were chosen from a list of 100 submitted by publishers, and were announced in January 2011 with in-shop and online support, as well as a media campaign for the final 11. The inaugural 11 included the Orange Prize Winner The Tiger's Wife by Téa Obreht, Man Booker Prize nominee Pigeon English, by Stephen Kelman and the Edinburgh International Book Festival First Book Award winner When God Was a Rabbit, by Sarah Winman. The last list was announced in January 2013, following the discontinuation of the prize in January 2014.
* 2011 – When God Was a Rabbit by Sarah Winman

link_mentions.page: List of cultural references to the September 11 attacks
response: *When God Was a Rabbit (2011) by Sarah Winman. The protagonist and her brother are living in America at the time of the 9/11 attacks, and the main character believes her brother and his best friend have died in the crash.

*When God Was a Rabbit by Sarah Winman - Winner of Edinburgh Book Festival Newton First Book Prize

When God Was a Rabbit is a book by Sarah Winman that was first published in 2011.  It won Winman various awards including New Writer of the Year in the Galaxy National Book Awards and was one of the books chosen by Richard & Judy in their 2011 Summer Book Club.
